result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D Mullins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Ct. 5 if revoked

Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: Ct. 5 if revoked

miscConds.notes: DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with Charles Famous.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

from def  re: added certificate to petition for sentence adjustment   (certificate added to sentence adjustment paperwork)

Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher D Mullins in court with attorney Pamela Popken.  Defendant Christopher D Mullins in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Upon plea to Cts 1 & 5, the balance are DRI. The State recommends, on Ct 1, 8 yrs WPS bifurcated as 5 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES-3 yrs consec probation. On Ct 5, 6 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES.

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher D Mullins in court with attorney Pamela Popken.  Defendant Christopher D Mullins in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.
Defense asks for COP  Plea hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 11:30 am.
allowing defense to have copy of electronic evidence with conditions

Defendant Christopher D Mullins in court with attorney Pamela Popken.  Defendant Christopher D Mullins in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The Court has received responses from both Mr. Cafferty and Ms. Popken. The State calls Inv. Kevin Kupper - DSAT. Cross xam by Mr. Cafferty. State marks Ex #1-Criminal complaint for case # 09CF714. The State asks that the Court take judicial notice of 09CF714. BTC: The Court takes judicial notice.
Parties give argument

BTC: The Court is satisfied, based on the testimony and facts of this case, that there is a safety concern and therefore will grant the State's motion. Defense will get the DVD but there are conditions. The State is to prepare an order.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
from Atty Popken, re: State's Motion scheduled for 1-21-16.

Defendant Christopher D Mullins in court with attorney Pamela Popken.  Defendant Christopher D Mullins in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Popken files motion to compel discovery. The State indicates that the deft and Ms. Popken refuse to sign the standard stipulation to release the DVD for release of DVD.

BTC: Defense will not be provided with the DVD of the controlled buy without signing the stipulation. Defense may file a motion for disclosure of the CI.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Christopher D Mullins in court with attorney Pamela L. Popken.  Defendant Christopher D Mullins in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendant, CF.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Christopher D Mullins in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Christopher D Mullins in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
